Pehrson Graduate Student Achievement Award for Xiaoyuan Liu 2022 UD CIS Distinguished Graduate Student awards for Cameron Ibrahim, Ankit Kulshrestha, Ilya Tyagin 2020 Outstanding Mentor Award to Ilya Safro 2020 Outstanding PhD student in Computer Science for Justin Sybrandt 2019 IEEE High Performance Extreme Computing (HPEC) Best Student Paper Award (Leading student Ruslan Shaydulin) 2018-now Multiple travel awards: SIAM Parallel Processing, Supercomputing, IEEE Quantum Computing and Engineering, IEEE HPEC and more Software Check our GitHub repo at https://github.com/safrolab I am a Professor and Associate Chair for Graduate Studies and Research in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences at the University of Delaware, with a joint appointment in the Department of Physics and Astronomy. I received my Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science from the Weizmann Institute of Science in Israel under the supervision of Achi Brandt and Dorit Ron. Prior to joining the University of Delaware, I was a professor in the School of Computing at Clemson University and a Faculty Scholar in the Clemson University School of Health Research. Earlier, I held a research position in the Division of Mathematics and Computer Science at Argonne National Laboratory with a joint appointment with the Computation Institute, University of Chicago. I completed my undergraduate studies in Mathematics and Computer Science at Ben-Gurion University of the Negev in Israel. I am co-chairing the Quantum Algorithms technical papers track in IEEE Quantum Computing and Engineering 2025. Please submit your papers! For students and applicants: I am always actively looking for highly motivated students to work with (both undergraduate and graduate). You are welcome to stop by my office to chat. Click here to check if I have an immediate M.Sc./Ph.D./Undergraduate/Internship opening.All applications must be submitted in Academentory.com where my positions are listed with relevant questions. Do not apply via email! Undergraduate students click here. If you are interested in quantum computing, you may also consider our graduate program in Quantum Science and Engineering that has a special track in quantum computing.
